document.text:
From: 
To: 
Bee: 
Subject: FW: 21-770 United States of America v. Maxwell "Motion FILED for hail" 
Date: Tue, 18 May 2021 05:14:20 +0000 
Attachments: Maxwell renewed bail motion.pdf 
After the Circuit rejected her prior bail appeal, Maxwell filed the attached "renewed motion" in the Circuit in the same 
docket. Can anyone think of a reason she can't do that? Even if it's not procedurally proper, it probably doesn't get us 
much, as she could just file a new notice of appeal from AJN's latest order and then file the same motion in the Circuit... 
From: cmecf@ca2.uscourts.gov <cmecf@ca2.uscourts.gov> 
Sent: Monda Ma 17 2021 4:50 PM 
To 
Subject: 21-770 United States of America v. Maxwell "Motion FILED for bail" 
•••NOTE TO PUBLIC ACCESS USERS*** Judicial Conference of the United States policy permits attorneys of 
record and parties in a case (including pro se litigants) to receive one free electronic copy of all documents 
filed electronically, if receipt is required by law or directed by the filer. PACER access fees apply to all other 
users. To avoid later charges, download a copy of each document during this first viewing. 
Court of Appeals, 2nd Circuit 
Notice of Docket Activity 
The following transaction was fi led on 05/17/2021 
Case Name: United States of America v. Maxwell 
Case Number: 21-770
